when I got my acceptance letter to HBS I
was completely thrilled called my father
immediately but it just sort of was like
a dream come true it's not like I had
some distinguished career in something
that I should get into HBS and so I
didn't necessarily expect to get in and
I was just so happy I think a lot of
people want to go to Harvard Business
School for the brand who wouldn't I
wanted to go to Harvard Business School
for the education there are very few
points in your lifetime were you can be
surrounded by such a large number of
incredibly smart people who are all
there with a common purpose that was
very young I had no big business
experience it opened up my mind to think
big and I always say that its cost the
same thing to think big as to think
small which is one of the things i
learned there the second thing was to
build confidence than when I left I had
a completely different outlook on the
world that changed my life harvard
college is a great place but harvard
business school was even a better place
for me because of the similarity of
everyone there and their total immersion
in business all we did was talk business
whether it was preparing for cases well
there was actually being involved in
case discussions so i really enjoyed the
business school the experience was just
terrific I came to HBS frightened
frightened because I still did not speak
English well enough to participate in
class to the extent that I wanted to and
so I took on a task of memorizing
dictionary I left HPS a much more
confident person feeling like I could
tackle entrepreneurship and become
successful you know I pretty much loved
it from the beginning I was scared but I
had fun and just about every class that
I went to the most satisfying experience
has to come from choosing to do things
that you felt passionate about
rather than things that you thought
would be financially rewarding or in any
other way rewarding deep down were all
people who realize that we have a higher
mission in life and you see enough
evidence to that in the younger
generation the her business school
education prepares our graduates to go
out and have great business careers
these distinguished alumni have had
truly remarkable careers as business

and I purchased software house and we
very probably named a company software
house international to signify our
ambition to become an international
company Shi has grown organically
without mergers or acquisitions we
posted less than a million dollar in

company this year we wanted to build a
different company where we can consider
the interests of all the key

everyone a customers employees
shareholders vendor partners in the
community a winner well we started the

on an industrial site then you could
make steam which could also be used in

allow you to have greater efficiency
because you're getting two uses out of

million dollars of capital we put
together at 275 million dollar power

leaps and bounds and we had four values
in the company when we started at one of
them was fun and we just clearly thought
that you know unless this is fun we
shouldn't be doing it I got a phone call

a converse corporation and it was in

me sort of carte blanche to reduce

wedding really loved was turn around
wouldn't you rather start at something
that's really messed up and try to fix

people can achieve great things given
direction and boundaries in 1983 I

Bank and we started the broker dealer

ninety-seven the back burner from six

I'd always felt like the environmental

being our principal interest in
environmental the activities of the

is that what the threats are that the

important part of society at SHI we have

different charity organizations
and we know that everyone has causes
that they support personally and care
about and for me that important cause is
cancer research over ten years ago my
older sister Margaret was diagnosed with
really a death sentence and we insisted
on my sister receiving a surgery as well
as chemotherapy and radiation treatment
and today she is free of cancer which is

believe a lot of in education so most of
our philanthropic efforts have been in
education something which has a
multiplier effect we also try to
concentrate on things which will go
beyond the immediate thing we see so
always in education we believe it to
help educate people which will hire
people which will educate people so the
efficiency of the investment for us is
very important so we always focus on

attachment and where we know where money
is going to be well invested when we
were a new firm in the late 60s and

wanted to use a tried-and-true method of

and we joined the united way today we

and things of that nature and joint

we've sent in mentors to help in private
and public schools to teach courses to
be big brothers to the students you know
when you've been involved in anything a
long time and it's meant a lot to you
it's actually important that you give
back
and since I've been fortunate in

we've been so fortunate we've had such

hours you will do whatever it takes to

it's hard so we don't love to do giving
that's about just direct service we are
